results.title: Wagga Wagga
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”
Shows family life and the rural, industrial and commercial interests of the city of Wagga Wagga, NSW. Also covers sporting, cultural and recreational activities.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rhonda Small, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Sydney: The School of the forties 1941-1981
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye”.
Man Feeding His Dogs (9min): A look at artist Russell Drysdale and his work. Madame Sosostris (10min): A joint product by artist James Gleeson and sculptor Robert Klippel is examined. Portrait of Dame Mary Gilmore (9min): An insight into one of Australia’s most controversial paintings. Sydney, 1942 (10min): A look at the work of Sali Herman.

results.title: The Australian impressionists 1888-1896
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye”.
A look at paintings by Australian impressionists - A Holiday at Mentone: Charles Conder (1888). The Breakaway: Tom Roberts (1890-91). Fire’s On, Lapstone Tunnel: Arthur Streeton (1891). Moonrise, Templestowe: David Davies (1894). On the Wallaby Track: Frederick McCubbin (1896).
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.description:

results.title: Sydney
results.creator_credit: Joe Scully, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
Presents many and varied aspects of life in Sydney including business and industrial activities, shops and supermarkets, play centres, schools and universities, hospitals and the rapid growth of new buildings. Shows the various recreational choices including football, cricket, surfing, yachting, fishing or just strolling in the beautiful parks and gardens and evening entertainment in the famous Kings Cross with its multitude of night clubs, restaurants and discotheques.

results.title: Sydney, 1942
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 27 of Series “The Australian eye”.
This painting represents the quintessence of Sali Herman’s art. He has enshrined in it the feeling of a time and place where once he lived and worked. The artist talks of his delight in recording the changing face of old Sydney such as Kings Cross and Woolloomooloo, and we see many of his finest works together with pages from his old sketch-books. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia

results.title: Australian modernists 1916-1942
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye”.
Features “Down the Hills to Berry’s Bay” : Roland Wakelin’s painting of Post-Impressionist style. “Rhythmic Composition in Yellow Green Minor” : An abstract painting by Roy de Maistre. “Study for Dog Gymkhana”: “Cubism art in Australia”. “Flying Over the Shoalhaven River”: The Work of Margaret Preston.

results.title: Four colonial painters 1832-1896
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye”.
Launceston and the River Tamar (10min): An Australian landscape by John Glover. “The Conciliation” (10min): A “history” painting done in 1840 by Benjamin Duterrau. “Mount William from Mount Dryden” (10min): This landscape reveals Eugene Von Guerard’s Romanticism. “Lake St. Clair” (10min): Work by William Charles Piquenit. Rated: G
